articles.title: In tirade amid mounting concerns, FIFA chief scolds critics of World Cup and Qatar - The Times of Israel
articles.description: In bizarre diatribe on eve of opening match, Infantino blasts 'hypocrisy' of Westerners who denounce Gulf state, says Europe should apologize for actions over 'past 3,000 years'
articles.content: DOHA, Qatar (AP) Gianni Infantino said he feels gay. That he feels like a woman. That he feels like a migrant worker. He lectured Europeans for criticizing Qatars human rights record and defended the… [+6730 chars]

articles.title: Fifa president Gianni Infantino accuses Europe of 'hypocrisy' and 'racism' over Qatar criticism - The Telegraph
articles.content:
Gianni Infantino, the Fifa president, accused Europe of "hypocrisy" and racism as he delivered an extraordinary 57-minute monologue hitting back at Qatar World Cup critics. 
Just 24 hours before the… [+2950 chars]

articles.title: World Cup: FIFA president Infantino slams Europe's hypocrisy in speech - ESPN
articles.description: FIFA president Gianni Infantino has lashed out at what he described as "hypocrisy" and "racism" from countries moralising about the Qatar World Cup.
